title: Rehabilitation of Twenty (20) National Highways through Local Contractors with funding from Local Banks
decision_details: - The Road Development Authority is vested with the responsibility of maintaining and up-keeping  of the network of National Highways in the country with a total length of 12,210 km. A length of approximately 7,900 km. of the National Highways has already been rehabilitated and nearly 4,300 km. have to be rehabilitated to a satisfactory standard.  Accordingly, the road  sections with 564.53 km. of 20 National Highways in A and B class spread over in the Island have been planned to be rehabilitated at an estimated cost of Rs.58 billion within the next three years. Considering, the enhancement of the capacity of local contractors and the importance of their achieving competency in the field of road construction, the proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to call for proposals from local entrepreneurs who are keen to adopt the Swiss Challenge Procurement Method, for the construction of the highways, was approved by the Cabinet.
